intro: Tarenna luhomeroensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tarenna, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow when mature, containing several seeds. Tarenna luhomeroensis is typically found in humid, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
